entry.defn: noun vanilla 香草冰激凌 xiāngcǎo bīngjilíng vanilla ice cream

noun 1 shortbread 杏仁酥 xìngrén sū almond shortbread 2 archaic VARIANT OF 30903296酥油su1you2酥油 butter adjective 1 crisp; short 酥饼 sūbǐng flaky pastry 酥糖 sūtáng crunchy candy; crisp sweets 2 (of a person's limbs) limp; weak; soft
noun gizzard 鸡胗儿 Jī zhēnr chicken’s gizzard
pork ball
noun betel pepper
noun 1 taro 2 dialect sweet potato
noun linguistics high and level tone (the first of the four tones in modern standard Chinese pronunciation) See 30835456四声si4sheng1四声
noun 1 falling tone (third of the four tones in classical Chinese pronunciation) 2 falling tone (fourth of the four tones in modern standard Chinese pronunciation) See 30835456四声si4sheng1四声
noun merciless and deadly enemy; sworn enemy; irreconcilable opponent
verb shoo away; drive off 轰麻雀 hōng máquè shoo away the sparrows 轰下台 hōng xiàtái hoot sb. off the platform; oust sb. from office (or power) 把他轰出去。 Bǎ tā hōng chūqu. Throw him out.
Jinan (capital of Shandong Province)
idiom It would be ungracious not to accept your kindness.
Bali (island province of Indonesia)
noun feeding (or nursing) bottle; (baby's) bottle
payment for private tutor
concubines
(qiánmázhěn 〈旧〉) noun medicine nettle rash; urticaria
noun 1 Old Man of the Moon (god of marriage) 2 matchmaker; go-between

noun 1 VARIANT OF 28352768前奏曲qian2zou4qu3前奏曲 music prelude 2 prelude 德国入侵波兰是第二次世界大战的前奏。 Déguó rùqīn Bōlán shì dì-èr cì shìjiè dàzhàn de qiánzòu. The German invasion of Poland was a prelude to World War II.
verb usually literary come 今天他举行婚礼, 许多同事前来贺喜。 Jīntiān tā jǔxíng hūnlǐ, xǔduō tóngshì qiánlái hèxǐ. Today is his wedding day and many of his colleagues came to congratulate him.
verb literary 1 unable to; cannot 不克胜任 Bù kè shèngrèn unequal to the job; not up to the job 2 fail to capture 屡攻不克 lǚ gōng bùkè repeated unsuccessful attacks

verb polite expression invite respectfully 敬请斧正。 Jìngqǐng fǔzhèng. Would you be kind enough to correct my poor work? 敬请光临。 Jìngqǐng guānglín. Your presence is cordially requested. 敬请指教。 Jìngqǐngzhǐjiào. Kindly give me your advice.
verb colloquial 1 join in the fun 2 add trouble to 我们够忙的, 别再来凑热闹了。 Wǒmen gòu máng de, bié zài lái còu rènao le. We’re busy enough as it is, don’t give us more trouble.

verb (-//-) bring to a conclusion; wind up 我们正在做收尾工作。 Wǒmen zhèngzài zuò shōuwěi gōngzuò. We are winding up the job. or We are in the last stages of the job. 你的文章可以用一句格言收尾。 Nǐ de wénzhāng kěyǐ yòng yī jù géyán shōuwěi. Try to wind up your essay with an aphorism. noun ending (of an article, etc.) 这个剧本收尾太平淡。 zhège jùběn shōuwěi tàipíng dàn. The ending of the play is flat.
1 practice (customary action, as opposed to theory) 2 practical
idiom sentimental and susceptible; overly sentimental; weak and emotional
Silicon Valley
noun chemistry selenium (Se)
our company (polite)
noun electronics wafer

noun phonograph (or gramophone) record; disc 放唱片 fàng chàngpiàn play a phonograph record 灌唱片 guàn chàngpiàn cut a disc (or CD) 白金唱片 báijīn chàngpiàn platinum record 激光唱片 jīguāng chàngpiàn laser disc 密纹唱片 mìwén chàngpiàn compact disc
noun imperial seal; (UK) privy seal
noun chemistry titanium (Ti)
1 tempura 2 deep-fried cooking 3 also called 甜不辣tiánbùlà [甜不辣]
adjective dialect vulgar [usu. said of a woman] flighty; batty; foolish 她这人真三八！ tā zhè rén zhēn sānbā! What a flighty person she is! noun March 8
noun sports softball 打垒球 dǎ lěiqiú play softball
verb participate in an exhibition
1 leave it to me (idiom) 2 I'll take care of it
verb clock; punch a card 上下班打卡 Shàngxiàbān dǎkǎ clock (or punch) in and out
noun 1 lane [usu. in street or lane names] 白纸坊 báizhǐ fāng White Paper Lane (a street in Beijing) 2 shop 茶坊 cháfāng teahouse 3 memorial archway See 27572736牌坊pai2fang5牌坊

verb 1 give a lot of care; take a lot of trouble 她为这些孩子可费了不少心。 Tā wèi zhèxiē háizi kě fèi le bùshǎo xīn. She devoted a lot of care to these children. 2 polite expression [making a request or giving thanks] may I trouble you (to do sth.); would you mind (doing sth.) 您见到他时, 费心把这封信交给他。 Nín jiàndào tā shí, fèixīn bǎ zhè fēng xìn jiāogěi tā. Will you be so kind as to give him this letter when you see him? 您帮了我们大忙, 费心了！ Nín bāng le wǒmen dàmáng, fèixīn le! You’ve helped us a lot. Thank you very much for taking all that trouble.
verb dialect polite expression may I…; trouble; please 劳烦您关上门。 láofán nín guān shàngmén. Do you mind shutting the door?
verb literary courteous arrive; be present 莅场 Lìchǎng be present on the occasion 莅任 lìrèn (of officials) assume one’s office; arrive at the post 莅席 lì xí be present at a banquet
noun pavilion or house on a terrace 水榭 shuǐxiè waterside pavilion
1 benchmark 2 pole serving as mark or symbol 3 pole with a trophy hung on it
noun 1 royal family 2 imperial (or royal) court
video (Tw)
noun hacker
noun penfriend; pen pal
verb dated (of girls) bind one's feet; foot-binding
mind reading (in psychology or Western magic)
surname Fan
noun 1 a thousand years; centuries 2 courteous birthday (other than one's own)
1 to have other... 2 to have a special ...
swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)
adjective frivolous; flippant; giddy 举止轻佻 Jǔzhǐ qīngtiāo flippant (or skittish) behaviour
noun shoe-pad; insole
Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber, wuxia (武侠wǔxiá [武侠], martial arts chivalry) novel by Jin Yong 金庸 Jīn Yōng [金庸] and its screen adaptations
noun vice-minister
noun player
noun ichthyology porgy

verb 1 specialize (in a subject); major (opp. 辅修,副修) 她主修原子物理。 Tā zhǔxiū yuánzǐ wùlǐ. She majors in atomic physics. 2 responsible for the repair or overhaul (of a machine) 王师傅主修这台磨床。 Wáng shīfu zhǔxiū zhè tái móchuáng. Master worker Wang is responsible for the overhaul of this grinder.
1 to have a close call 2 to have a narrow escape

noun decorum; propriety; decency 有失体统 yǒushī tǐtǒng disgraceful; scandalous 他这样无理取闹, 成何体统！ Tā zhèyàng wúlǐqǔnào, chéng hé tǐtǒng! He’s just being difficult and it’s so embarrasing! See 17892352不成体统bu4cheng2ti3tong3不成体统
official career fraught with difficulties and danger; difficult career
noun 1 photograph (or picture, photo) album 2 TV miniseries; soap opera
verb 1 breathe one's last; die 2 cut off the gas; gas stoppage

noun 1 emergency call; emergency treatment 挂急诊 Guà jízhěn register as an emergency case 这病不能耽误, 上医院看急诊吧。 Zhè bìng bù néng dānwu, shàng yīyuàn kàn jízhěn ba. This kind of illness allows no delay. Go right to hospital for emergency treatment. 2 emergency (case)
noun full stop; period (。)(.)
stalker
it's a small world (idiom)
noun boiling point (opp. 冰点)
noun physics freezing point (opp. 沸点) 温度降到冰点。 Wēndù jiàngdào bīngdiǎn. The temperature fell below freezing.
Christian Johann Doppler, Austrian physicist who discovered the Doppler effect
idiom indispensable; vital 水和空气为生命所不可或缺。 Shuǐ hé kōngqì wéi shēngmìng suǒ bùkěhuòquē. Water and air are indispensable to life.

verb be the first to explore, develop, innovate, etc.; forerun noun pioneer; forerunner; harbinger 聂耳, 冼星海是中国革命音乐的先驱。 Niè Ěr, Xiǎn Xīnghǎi shì Zhōngguó gémìng yīnyuè dexiānqū. Nie Er and Xian Xinghai were pioneers of China’s revolutionary music.
verb dialect sip 呷一口茶 xiā yī kǒu chá take a sip of tea
idiom come first on the list; second to none 老王的棋艺在我们公司是首屈一指的。 lǎo wáng de qíyì zài wǒmen gōngsī shì shǒuqūyīzhǐ de. Lao Wang is the best chess player in our company.
verb subdue; vanquish; tame 降伏野马 xiángfú yěmǎ break in a wild horse 谁降伏得了那野小子？ Shuí xiángfú déle nà yě xiǎozi？ Who can tame that unruly boy?
noun Potsdam (a city near Berlin)
noun Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895 (launched by Japanese imperialists to annex Korea and invade China)
noun literary officers and men; commanders and fighters
noun shipping; vessels 船只失事 chuánzhī shīshì shipwreck 往来船只 wǎnglái chuánzhī shipping traffic 载货船只 zàihuò chuánzhī carrying vessels
noun bitter orange
awaiting the news of your success
noun state of being frightened; fearful 惊魂稍定 Jīnghún shāo dìng barely recovered from a fright
noun 1 dense fog 2 miasma; unhealthy or evil influence; anything that misleads people
noun slogan; poster 张贴标语 zhāngtiē biāoyǔ put up slogans (or posters)
noun transliteration totem
one (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
noun 1 archaic boundary 2 (Qí) a surname
noun pejorative 1 shadow; person who follows another closely 2 toady; lackey
noun chalk (a type of limestone)
diatom
noun zoology flying squirrel (Petaurista)
mammoth
1 (slang) stupid 2 moron
verb medicine natural labour; normal childbirth; eutocia (opp. 难产) 婴儿顺产。 yīng'ér shùnchǎn The baby was born after an easy labour.
noun postage stamp; stamp 邮票面值 yóupiào miànzhí face value of a postage stamp 特种邮票 tèzhǒng yóupiào special stamps 一套纪念邮票 Yī tào jìniàn yóupiào a set of commemorative stamps
pick quarrels and stir up trouble
literary noun figured woven silk material; damask adjective beautiful; gorgeous 绮思 qǐsī beautiful thoughts (in literature)
noun sports javelin
botany hops (Humulus lupulus)
noun malt 麦芽酶 màiyá méi maltose
kumquat
noun yeast
noun locomotive; engine
noun music modes of ancient Chinese music
noun literary 1 bamboo grove 幽篁 yōuhuáng secluded and restful bamboo grove 2 bamboo 修篁 xiū huáng tall bamboos
noun dried meat (esp. pork) floss
noun paper clip
noun special case for investigation; case 这件事应成立专案。 Zhè jiàn shì yīng chénglì zhuān'àn. This should be made a special case for investigation.
1 affidavit 2 written pledge
verb carry on as before; follow 沿袭陈规 Yánxí chénguī follow convention 沿袭成说 yánxí chéngshuō adopt an accepted theory 沿袭已久的框框 yánxí yǐjiǔ de kuàngkuang long-standing restrictions
1 portable charger 2 mobile power pack
noun octopus
Asahi (Japanese place name, company name etc)
VARIANT OF 76489187圆柏yuan2bai3圆柏 yuánbǎi noun botany Chinese juniper (Juniperus chinensis)
noun archaic square grain receptacle used at sacrificial ceremonies
noun archaic round-mouthed food vessel with two or four loop handles

noun 1 archaic astronomy kui (the fifteenth of the twenty-eight zodiacal constellations (二十八宿) into which the celestial sphere was divided, consisting of sixteen stars, said to be like a person striding, in Pisces) 奎宿九 kuí xiǔ jiǔ Mirach 2 (Kuí) a surname
verb (of masts, smokestacks, derricks, tall buildings, etc.) stand (in great numbers) like a forest 港口樯桅林立。 Gǎngkǒu qiáng wéi línlì. There is a forest of masts in the harbour.
(slang) loser (loanword) (Tw)
Mengjia (also written Monga, Monka or Bangka), the pre-Japanese-era name for Wanhua 万华Wànhuá [万华], the oldest district of Taipei
noun ornithology egret
noun Chinese sweet gum (Liquidambar formosana)

verb go the rounds; tour; make a circuit of 剧团正在全国各地巡回演出。 Jùtuán zhèng zài quánguó gè dì xúnhuí yǎnchū. The theatrical troupe is touring the country. 教师到放牧点上进行巡回教学。 Jiàoshī dào fàngmù diǎn shàng jìnxíng xúnhuí jiàoxué. The teachers make a circuit of the herding centres to give lessons.
adjective ardent; eager 殷切的期望 yīnqiè de qīwàng ardent expectations
Hanoi, capital of Vietnam
Sapporo, Japan
Okinawa
noun Ryukyu (Islands)
idiom The fire is singeing the eyebrows.—a desperate situation; at a crucial point 火烧眉毛的事儿 Huǒ shāo méimao de shìr matter of the utmost urgency
airline terminal
Fangyuan township in Changhua county 彰化县Zhānghuàxiàn [彰化县], Taiwan
Zhanghua or Changhua city and county in west Taiwan
noun unfounded rumour; false report

adjective 1 partial; showing particular favour to 她对小儿子有点儿偏心。 Tā duì xiǎo érzi yǒu diǎnr piānxīn. She rather favours her youngest son. or Her youngest son is rather her favourite. 2 mechanics eccentric
1 (the item) named above 2 aforementioned 3 cited above 4 op. cit.
verb store; keep in storage
1 report on 2 information
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
Wei (220-265) and Jin (265-420) dynasties
adverb literary suddenly; quickly 羊城一别, 倏已半年。 Yáng chéng yī bié, shū yǐ bàn nián. Six months have passed in a flash since we parted in the City of Rams ( i.e. Guangzhou).

literary verb experience; temper oneself 让孩子出门历练一番。 Ràng háizi chūmén lìliàn yī fān. Let the child go out to see the world. adjective experienced; seasoned 历练老成 lì liàn lǎo chéng be experienced and prudent
adjective transliteration modern; fashionable 摩登家具 módēng jiāju fashionable furniture

noun symptom of a trend; suggestion of a new development 要注意不良倾向的苗头。 Yào zhùyì bùliáng qīngxiàng de miáotou. Watch out for symptoms of unhealthy tendencies. 他一看苗头不对, 就溜了。 Tā yī kàn miáotou bùduì, jiù liū le. He slipped off when he saw what was going to happen.

noun archaic 1 crossboard at the rear of a carriage 2 carriage 3 astronomy zhen (the last of the twenty-eight constellations (二十八宿) of the celestial sphere, consisting of four stars in Corvus) adjective literary sorrowful; distressed 轸悼 zhěndào mourn deeply
study in the US
adjective solemn and quiet; solemn and respectful 纪念会气氛肃穆。 Jìniànhuì qìfēn sùmù. The commemoration meeting was permeated with a solemn atmosphere.
noun Buddhist monks and nuns
noun horsetail whisk
noun literary 1 person of outstanding ability (or superior talents) 2 talent; outstanding ability; wisdom
1 to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc) 2 to miss out on (an opportunity) 3 to fail to gain (victory etc)
1 to hold memorial service 2 to hold a funeral
verb make funeral arrangements; prepare a funeral
adjective unlucky 一脸晦气 yī liǎn huìqi gloomy look that suggests bad luck 碰到这种事真是晦气！ Pèngdào zhèzhǒng shì zhēnshi huìqi! Just my rotten luck!
verb (of gods or immortals) descend to the human world
noun troubled times; turbulent days
1 really 2 truly 3 indeed 4 real 5 true 6 genuine
Zhou Xin (c. 11th century BC), last emperor of the of Shang Dynasty
Da Ji (the favourite concubine of King Zhou (纣王), the last ruler of Shang Dynasty)
Baosi, concubine of King You of Zhou 周幽王 Zhōu Yōuwáng [周幽王] and one of the famous Chinese beauties

noun Eight Characters (in four pairs, indicating the year, month, day, and hour of a person's birth, each pair consisting of one Heavenly Stem (天干) and one Earthly Branch (地支), formerly used in fortune-telling) 问八字 wèn bāzì consult one’s horoscope; consult a fortune-teller

verb 1 make a vow (to a god) 烧香许愿 shāoxiāngxǔyuàn burn incense and make vows 2 promise sb. a reward 我给孩子许了愿, 要是他这次考好了带他去海边玩。 Wǒ gěi háizi xǔ le yuàn, yào shì tā zhècì kǎo hǎo le dài tā qù hǎibiān wán. I promised the child to take him to the seaside if he did well in the exam.

verb 1 bow (one's head) (opp. 仰) See 21229056俯视fu3shi4俯视 2 bend over 俯下身子捡起来 fǔ xià shēnzi jiǎn qǐlai bend down and pick up sth. 3 dated courteous [in official documents or letters] condescend to 俯允 fǔyǔn condescend to give permission

literary noun eventuality; contingency 以备不虞 yǐ bèi bùyú prepare for any contingency verb 1 unexpected See 18007296不虞之誉bu4yu2zhi1yu4不虞之誉 2 not worry about 不虞匮乏 bù yú kuìfá fear no shortage of material resources; not worry about running out of supplies
noun principles of action; guidelines 面授机宜 miànshòujīyí brief sb. on how to act
verb be rid of calamities 消灾免祸 xiāo zāi miǎn huò avert calamities; avoid disasters 祈求神灵消灾降福 Qíqiú shénlíng xiāo zāi jiàng fú pray to the gods to ward off calamities and send down blessings
noun textile silk fabric finer than satin; damask silk
1 to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success) 2 to take off 3 to soar (of prices)

noun dated official report; petition See 17752320禀帖bing3tie3禀帖 verb 1 literary report (to one's superior or senior); petition 回禀 huíbǐng report back (to one’s superior) 2 receive; endowed with See 17751040禀赋bing3fu4禀赋
1 to gather 2 to collect
(Tw) bowl of boiled rice with other food on top (loanword from Japanese "donburi")
noun chassis (of a car, etc.)
